alert.note: Alert for Greater Lake Tahoe Area (Nevada) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Blizzard Warning issued February 25 at 4:19PM PST until March 01 at 4:00AM PST by NWS Reno
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 10 AM SUNDAY TO 10 AM PST MONDAY... ...BLIZZARD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 10 AM MONDAY TO 4 AM PST WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...For the Winter Storm Warning, heavy snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 4 to 8 inches, except 10 to 18 inches above 7000 feet. Winds gusting as high as 45 mph. For the Blizzard Warning, blizzard conditions expected. Total snow accumulations of 2 to 3 feet, except 4 to 6 feet above 7000 feet. Winds gusting as high as 55 mph with over 100 mph along Sierra ridgetops. * WHERE...Greater Lake Tahoe Area. * WHEN...For the Winter Storm Warning, from 10 AM Sunday to 10 AM PST Monday. For the Blizzard Warning, from 10 AM Monday to 4 AM PST Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be impossible with near zero visibility at times Monday through early Wednesday morning. Strong winds could cause tree damage and power outages. If you risk travel you could become stranded in vehicles for hours.
info.instruction: Avoid travel if possible, you could be stuck in your vehicle for many hours. If you must travel, prepare for long delays and carry an emergency kit with extra food, water and clothing. If you stay home, have a backup plan in case of power outages. This is a life threatening situation. Do not attempt to travel during blizzard conditions! Road crews and first responders may not be able to rescue you. Stay indoors until the snow and wind subside. Even a short walk could be deadly if you become disoriented. The latest road conditions can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
